docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Robert G. Torricelli, the Democratic candidate for the United States Senate seat in New Jersey being vacated by Bill Bradley, met with reporters and editors of The New York Times for about 90 minutes yesterday to discuss issues in his race against Representative Richard A. Zimmer, a Republican. Following are excerpts from the session. Advertisements Q. You've already said that if Zimmer would sign a pledge to maintain only positive ads, that you would do the same thing. What's stopping you from doing it on your own?

headline.main: 'I'm Going to Keep My Dignity': Excerpts From Torricelli Interview
